Hey Oliver.

I run ubuntu myself and it works fine, but I use a custom vers=
ion of
wxwidgets.  I'm going to look into what might be causing your proble=
m
with the default wxwidgets library.

In the meantime, you can turn off th=
e GUI by using the "ccmake"
command and setting the "use gui" flag to off.
=

I'll let you know what I find out.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Oliver C=
oleman" <oliver@...> wrote:
>
> I seem to have gotten all the dependencies =
sorted out, all that remains
> is what seems to be language syntax differen=
ces between compilers (or
> versions). Which compiler and version was it or=
iginally written for?
> I've tried compiling with GCC (G++) versions 3.3, 3=
.4, 4.1 and 4.2, for
> versions >=3D 3.4 I get errors like:
> 
> HCUBE_Eval=
uationPanel.h:9: error: expected class-name before `{'
> token
> 
> HCUBE_E=
valuationPanel.h:48: error: `wxPaintEvent' has not been
> declared
> 
> (Th=
ese seems to be a problem with the wxwidgets library, which seems odd
> giv=
en that I installed it from the Ubuntu repositories):
> 
> /usr/include/wx-=
2.8/wx/cursor.h:65: error: `wxIsBusy' was not
> declared in this scope
> 
>=
 /usr/include/wx-2.8/wx/gtk1/region.h:47: error: no matching function for
>=
 call to `wxRegion::Union(const wxBitmap&, const wxColour&,
> int&)'
> 
> /=
usr/include/wx-2.8/wx/region.h:127: note: candidates are: bool
> wxRegionBa=
se::Union(wxCoord, wxCoord, wxCoord, wxCoord)
> 
> Any ideas anyone? I'm th=
inking I should modify the code (not sure what

 to compile under G++ 4.2 and post it back to

as much info as I can get before proceeding
